channel.title: 4 Pics 1 Word PHP/HTML?
channel.description: the popular games in which you have 4 pictures and you must guess the word, is this possible for html/PHP?

item.title: 4 Pics 1 Word PHP/HTML?
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:16, topic:533630”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=652418.msg4372431#msg4372431 date=1381082098]

“Security can be worked on later”

No. Why. Why would you even.

if you’re learning there’s nothing wrong with ignoring a few areas to make it a bit easier for yourself. INB4 U MUST LEARN EVERYTHING ABOUT COMPUTERS BEFORE U WRITE CODE, AND IT MUST BE AS DIFFICULT AS POSSIBLE BECAUSE ONLY THE SMARTEST PEOPLE SHOULD BE ALLOWED TO CODE
[/quote]

Seriously? I think it’s pretty obvious security is the most important part of a web application… Anyone who develops web applications for others should be using proper security practices. If he was as mindful of his security flaw as he says he was, he should’ve atleast pointed out the flaw, not left it totally out of his post. It’s not that the code was bad that pissed me off, it’s how he totally pretends to have been mindful of the fact it was insecure once it was pointed out to him.[/quote]
I wasn’t pretending anything. It’s not a one-way conversation, if OP built the game I’d have mentioned security later. OP hasn’t even replied and might have even forgotten about this thread.

xx matty xx:

if you’re learning there’s nothing wrong with ignoring a few areas to make it a bit easier for yourself.

Exactly. Security is vital but if you’re just trying to learn php then it can wait, especially if it isn’t a commercial site. Also, it’s probably better to know why and how the security flaw is there, before you go try and fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Pics 1 Word PHP/HTML?
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:11, topic:533630”][quote author=runeite51 link=topic=652418.msg4371811#msg4371811 date=1380873913]

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=652418.msg4371775#msg4371775 date=1380855853]
Absolutely don’t listen to runeite.
[/quote]Why don’t you contribute then?[/quote]

I’m on the road with a laptop that gets really slow when you use it only slightly (no one thought about heating issues when they put this particular model together).

When I get home, though, I might as well write my own and just open source it for OP.[/quote]
Cool, I don’t mean any hate, I’ll be sure to check it out.

edit: My laptop heats up pretty fast too. You should invest in a cooler if you haven’t already, it can help a lot.

[quote=“justaguy, post:10, topic:533630”][quote author=runeite51 link=topic=652418.msg4371811#msg4371811 date=1380873913]

Well for one… What if I go and change the value of that cookie to whatever I want? I could then get to any level I want, not to mention this is actually a security hole.
[/quote]I realize this is not secure. I posted that to get OP started. I don’t know his skill level in web developing, which the length of the tutorial depends greatly on.

So then what the heck is the point in posting that? As if you knew it was insecure… don’t give me that nonsense.[/quote]
Drop your ego. OP didn’t post anything about what he can do. Security can be worked on later, after he gets the actual game working. I think posting a full tutorial with every little security fix will be overwhelming, given that he wasn’t able to even get the game up at all. If you’re so great then post a tutorial yourself, web developer.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Pics 1 Word PHP/HTML?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“runeite51, post:5, topic:533630”][quote author=pkerjosh13 link=topic=652418.msg4371591#msg4371591 date=1380817443]
Im not looking to be spoon feed but is there any tutorials on it, because i tried to create one and it did not go so well. thanks for the quick reply!
[/quote]
Here, I’ll help you out. I’ll assume you know basic PHP and can Google ;p

First create your index.php and check.php, then make a folder called levels.
index.php will be the template, check.php will check answers, and the levels are stores in the levels folder.

Just fyi, without mySQL there can’t be a log in system. As for saving progress, we can use a cookie.

setcookie("current_level", "1", time()+(10 * 365 * 24 * 60 * 60)); //Set to expire in 10 years.

After you’ve styled your index.php, remember just the template, add an include for the actual game.

include 'levels/level'.$_COOKIE['current_level'].'.inc.php';

Now store your levels as level1.inc.php, level2.inc.php, level3.inc.php, etc.

Your level*.inc.php files will have the actual game. You can use a form. Make sure there’s a hidden input for the answer

<input type="hidden" value="answer to puzzle">

For something with the answer “airplane” Your form should look something like

<form action="check.php" method="POST">
   <input type="text">
   <input type="hidden" value="airplane">
   <input type="submit">
</form>

Which would submit the form to check.php.
In check.php if the answer is right, give them their congratulations, update the cookie, and redirect them back.
If they’re wrong, redirect them back, without updating the cookie.

if(correct){ echo "Good job!" setcookie("current_level", $_COOKIE['current_level']+1, time()+(10 * 365 * 24 * 60 * 60)); //$_COOKIE['current_level']+1 gets current level and adds 1. header('Refresh: 3; url="http://www.yourwebsite.com"'); //this will redirect after 3 seconds. } else { echo "Sorry, try again!" header('Refresh: 3; url="http://www.yourwebsite.com"'); //this will redirect after 3 seconds. } [/quote]

Well for one… What if I go and change the value of that cookie to whatever I want? I could then get to any level I want, not to mention this is actually a security hole.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 Pics 1 Word PHP/HTML?
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

pkerjosh13:

Im not looking to be spoon feed but is there any tutorials on it, because i tried to create one and it did not go so well. thanks for the quick reply!

Here, I’ll help you out. I’ll assume you know basic PHP and can Google ;p

First create your index.php and check.php, then make a folder called levels.
index.php will be the template, check.php will check answers, and the levels are stores in the levels folder.

Just fyi, without mySQL there can’t be a log in system. As for saving progress, we can use a cookie.

setcookie("current_level", "1", time()+(10 * 365 * 24 * 60 * 60)); //Set to expire in 10 years.

After you’ve styled your index.php, remember just the template, add an include for the actual game.

include 'levels/level'.$_COOKIE['current_level'].'.inc.php';

Now store your levels as level1.inc.php, level2.inc.php, level3.inc.php, etc.

Your level*.inc.php files will have the actual game. You can use a form. Make sure there’s a hidden input for the answer

<input type="hidden" value="answer to puzzle">

For something with the answer “airplane” Your form should look something like

<form action="check.php" method="POST">
   <input type="text">
   <input type="hidden" value="airplane">
   <input type="submit">
</form>

Which would submit the form to check.php.
In check.php if the answer is right, give them their congratulations, update the cookie, and redirect them back.
If they’re wrong, redirect them back, without updating the cookie.

if(correct){
   echo "Good job!"
   setcookie("current_level", $_COOKIE['current_level']+1, time()+(10 * 365 * 24 * 60 * 60)); //$_COOKIE['current_level']+1 gets current level and adds 1.
   header('Refresh: 3; url="http://www.yourwebsite.com"'); //this will redirect after 3 seconds.
} else {
   echo "Sorry, try again!"
   header('Refresh: 3; url="http://www.yourwebsite.com"'); //this will redirect after 3 seconds.
}

Read full topic
